articles.title: VoidZero: A Next-Generation Toolchain for JavaScript
articles.description: Not content to have merely created Vue.js and Vite, JavaScript powerhouse Evan You has unveiled his latest adventure: a $4.6m funded company building an open-source unified development toolchain for the JavaScript ecosystem. With his track record, this is as good an attempt as it gets.
articles.author: Evan You

articles.title: ESLint Now Officially Supports Linting JSON and Markdown
articles.description: ESLint has been taking steps to become a more general purpose linter and that effort is beginning to bear fruit with this milestone.
articles.author: Nicholas C. Zakas

articles.title: Tauri 2.0: Small, Fast Desktop Apps using Web Technologies
articles.description: Tauri is a Rust-based alternative to Electron for bringing together HTML, JavaScript and CSS code to create cross-platform desktop apps. Rather than using V8, it uses the natively available webview to run your code.
articles.author: Tillmann Weidinger

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Bundling: The Past, Present and Future
articles.description: A history lesson on bundlers, why they‚Äôre used, the problems they solve, the current ecosystem, and a look at the potential future for these tools.
articles.author: Devon Govett

articles.title: Unleash JavaScript's Potential with Functional Programming
articles.description: More focused on the how, rather than the why, but a good primer nonetheless, especially if you‚Äôve never tried to learn about FP before.
articles.author: Jan Hesters

articles.title: SVG Coding Examples: Useful Recipes for Writing Vectors by Hand
articles.description: Explores the basics of hand-coding SVGs, how to use JavaScript along the way, and practical examples to demystify the inner workings of common SVG elements.
articles.author: Myriam Frisano

articles.title: ü§ñ¬†assistant-ui: React Components for AI Chat
articles.description: It doesn‚Äôt just give you the interface components, but has integrations for Vercel AI, Langchain, and talking to other common LLM APIs (e.g. OpenAI), enabling you to build your own in-house AI chat system quickly. Examples.
articles.author: Simon Farshid

articles.title: qrframe: A Library to Generate 'Pretty' QR Codes
articles.description: It's slightly odd as the QR codes generated aren‚Äôt guaranteed to scan reliably, but if you can generate ones that do, they look striking, and could be useful for branding/fun use cases. Play around with a live demo here.
articles.author: Kyle Zheng

articles.title: Superdiff 2.0: Compares Two Arrays or Objects and Return a Diff
articles.description: Got two similar objects and want to see the underlying differences?
articles.author: antoine

articles.title: ¬µExpress / Ultimate Express: Like Express, But Faster
articles.description: Imagine a reimplementation of Express with full API compatibility, but based on ¬µWebSockets and with an optimized router for faster performance.
articles.author: dimden

articles.title: VueFormify 1.1: Simple Type-Safe Form Building for Vue
articles.description: Bills itself as ‚Äúyour ticket to form-building autonomy.‚Äù There‚Äôs a getting started guide and GitHub repo.
articles.author: M√°t√© Nagy

articles.title: pretty-print: Customizable String Representations of JS Values
articles.description: Produce a string representation of any value. Similar to util.inspect but with many extra options for tree-ifying, coloring, sorting, choosing what to display, etc.
articles.author: Effectful Technologies Inc

articles.description: üòç Build tool Vite has a snazzy new homepage just in time for ViteConf.
The Svelte team shares everything that's new with Svelte lately.
üïπÔ∏è OneJS is an attempt to bring JavaScript scripting into the Unity game engine. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Here's a screencast showing it off.
üéÇ The Knip code decluttering tool celebrates two years with a new release containing a revamped auto-fix mechanism for automatically removing unused exports and files from your code.
Congratulations to Ulises Gasc√≥n for becoming the newest TC39 Delegate.
Eleventy / 11ty 3.0 ‚Äì Node.js-powered static site generator.
Tabulator 6.3 ‚Äì Popular interactive table / data grid control.
Jiti 2.0 ‚Äì Runtime TypeScript and ESM support for Node.js.
pnpm 9.12 ‚Äì The alternative, efficient package manager.

articles.title: Catching Up on the WordPress & WP Engine Situation
articles.description: There‚Äôs been plenty of continued drama in the WordPress world between Automattic and WP Engine ‚Äî and this post attempts to bring us up to speed. More has happened since including ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Matt Mullenweg sitting down with Theo Browne for a chat about the situation, and some new terms have been shared.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: The HTTP QUERY Method
articles.description: A draft spec for a new QUERY HTTP method, a ‚Äúsafe, idempotent request method that can carry request content‚Äù. It‚Äôs said to be desirable ‚Äúwhen the data conveyed in a request is too voluminous to be encoded into the request‚Äôs URI‚Äù. It's not quite GET, but it's not quite POST..
articles.author: Reschke, Malhotra, Snell, Bishop

articles.title: Web Components Are Okay
articles.description: Spent any time on social this week? You may have spotted many in the frontend community talking about and questioning the overall merit and utility of Web Components. Nolan ties a few of these arguments together, concluding that folks are generally ‚Äútalking past each other because they‚Äôre building different things with different constraints‚Äù.
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: CSS Masonry & CSS Grid
articles.description: As mentioned last week, steam is picking up on a formal CSS solution for masonry layouts, but with two competing proposals and lots of various opinions on both flying around, it‚Äôs good to take a high-level overview of where things stand ‚Äî that‚Äôs what this is.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: Interview With Bj√∂rn Ottosson, Creator of the Oklab Color Space
articles.description: A chat with the Swedish engineer who created the Oklab color space, covering how he approached developing an effective model, with good hue uniformity, while also handling lightness and saturation well.
articles.author: Philip J√§genstedt

articles.title: What‚Äôs the Difference Between HTML‚Äôs Dialog Element and Popovers?
articles.description: Whilst pretty similar in both look and functionality Chris highlights the important distinctions, differing APIs, and overall use cases.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: How To Manage Dangerous Actions In User Interfaces
articles.description: An exploration of different strategies we can use to prevent users from making mistakes (such as unintentionally sending an email, placing an order, hitting publish on something, etc).
articles.author: Victor Ponamariov

articles.title: How To Make a¬†‚ÄúScroll¬†To Select‚Äù Form Control
articles.description: This is an interesting little experiment, turning the humble <select> element into a dial of sorts, kinda like the scrollable date picker often seen on iOS. You select an option by scrolling it into position.
articles.author: Preethi Sam

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Fundamentals of Frontend Architecture
articles.description: A free video course that covers ‚Äúeverything you need to know to build robust and scalable frontend applications‚Äù. It covers architectural drivers, documentation, decision making, prototyping, implementation, and more.
articles.author: Maxi Ferreira

articles.title: SVG Coding Examples: Useful Recipes for Writing Vectors by¬†Hand
articles.description: Explores the basics of hand-coding SVGs, how to leverage JavaScript along the way, plus practical examples to demystify the inner workings of common SVG elements.
articles.author: Myriam Frisano

articles.title: CrUX Vis
articles.description: A new, experimental, browser-based Chrome User Experience Report (CrUX) tool to allow you to visualize CrUX History API data. This related blog post from Matt Zeunert explains what it does in more detail.
articles.author: Jamison O'Keefe

articles.title: Eleventy v3.0 Is Now Available
articles.description: A popular Node.js-based static site generator. This release is written in ESM with full ESM support, is 20% smaller, has 11% fewer dependencies, and installs faster. The Eleventy Image utility hit v5 too.
articles.author: Zach Leatherman

articles.title: tailwind-to-inline: A Tailwind CSS to Inline Styles Converter
articles.description: The target use case is email template creation. Quickly craft the templates using Tailwind CSS, but then inline everything for the final version.
articles.author: Vardan Hakobyan

articles.title: OctoPalm.js: A Lightweight JavaScript Utility to Add Customizable Search Functionality to Your Apps
articles.description: Includes features like animated results, customizable scrollbars for lengthy search lists, and real-time results as the user types.
articles.author: Eddie Gulay

articles.title: TinyJS: A Lightweight Library to Easily Generate and Customize DOM Elements
articles.description: Includes a jQuery-like syntax for element selection, iteration, and appending content and adding properties to elements. Nothing you couldn‚Äôt do with vanilla JS, but a much simpler API.
articles.author: Victor Ribeiro
